summary: This is an internal email chain among US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) prosecutors regarding scheduling a call with the SEC about their Epstein inquiry. The SEC is seeking to coordinate to avoid interfering with the criminal case.

persons.name: MI (USANYS)
persons.context: Email sender who confirms availability for a call with the SEC at 4:45 PM.

persons.name: MM (USANYS)
persons.context: Email initiator who informs colleagues about the SEC's call regarding their Epstein inquiry and proposes a group call.

connections.description: Both are prosecutors in the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York coordinating on a call with the SEC.

events.title: SEC inquiry coordination call
events.description: The SEC contacted the US Attorney's Office with questions about their Epstein inquiry, seeking to avoid actions problematic for the criminal case. Prosecutors planned a call to discuss.

keyFacts: The SEC was conducting an inquiry into Epstein matters as of August 2019.
The SEC was proactively coordinating with criminal prosecutors to avoid interfering with the criminal case.
The email shows internal scheduling among SDNY prosecutors regarding this inter-agency communication.
